page.title: 09DRAYTON'S DAIRY
page.content: Winfrith Newburgh is a very large parish consisting mainly dairy and arable farming.In the Domesday Book there was land for 24 ploughs.The manor and lands of Winfrith were given to Robert Newburgh by Henry 1 so the village became Winfrith Newburgh.It stayed with this family until the early 17th.Century when it was sold to Humphrey Weld.The land has stayed with this family ever since.In 1768 the Act of Enclosure changed when Common land was enclosed.Before this some farmers changed their strips of land with each other and gathered them together in 'Lots'.One farmer Abraham Drayton did this over 240 years ago and we went to visit it.Drayton's Dairy is next door to our school.Mr.Hastings the manager showed us round.First we went to look at the prize cows,they were getting ready for the'Royal Agricultural Show'
